info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 11:37PM EDT until July 15 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following counties, Middlesex, Morris and Somerset.
* WHEN...Until 315 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1136 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported road closures due to flooding from heavy rain early Monday evening. Flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Somerville, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Carteret, Madison, Middlesex and Florham Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT TUESDAY

area.areaDesc: Middlesex, NJ; Morris, NJ; Somerset, NJ
